newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Stocks active in scattered trade.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Stocks active in scattered trade.

text.p: Stocks were active in the after-hours session amid scattered trading but attracted no significant operations, traders said Tuesday.
"The market is recuperating from the big swing in the daily session," one trader said.
U.S. blue chips ended lower after a wild ride in which a 100-point gain in the Dow Jones Industrial Average unraveled in the last hours of the session.

EMC Corp was trading at 36-3/4 against a close of 37-3/4 on the New York Stock Exchange, Iomega Corp was down at 18-1/2 against 19, Netscape Communications Corp was even at 38, while Warrantech Corp was up 11-1/8 against 11.

EMC had fourth quarter earnings of $0.50 a share against $0.26 for the same period last year. Iomega reported fourth quarter EPS of $0.15 against $0.08, Netscape saw its fourth quarter share rise to $0.10 from $0.01 and Warrantech had its third quarter rise to $0.12 from $0.09.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had a volume of 194,400 shares compared to 131,500 on Monday, while session two had 14,957,030 shares against 81,700.
